contentencoded:
Dateline:
Computer problems delayed Minnesota schools from testing students in the last two days. The delays were caused by a server malfunction at testing company Pearson.

Students did not have re-do a test or lose any data, but there were problems being able to log in at the start to take the MCA standardized test.

MPR News' Tom Weber gets the
description: Listen to Charlene Briner, Minnesota Department of Education chief of staff, for the latest updates on the testing system.
title: Digital testing glitches hit Minnesota schools
teaser: Listen to Charlene Briner, Minnesota Department of Education chief of staff, for the latest updates on the testing system.
